references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of adversarial machine learning, introducing the concept of adversarial examples and highlighting the vulnerability of neural networks to these attacks.
This work provides a deeper understanding of adversarial examples, explaining their mechanism and proposing techniques to harness them for improving model robustness.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces the CLIP model, a foundational vision-language model that enables zero-shot image classification and is leveraged in this paper to enhance adversarial robustness.

references.paper_title: Theoretically principled trade-off between robustness and accuracy
references.reason: This work introduces the TRADES method, a theoretically sound adversarial training method that balances adversarial robustness with model accuracy, which this paper adapts to the prompt learning setting.
This paper introduces the concept of prompt tuning for vision models, a parameter-efficient adaptation method that is crucial for the few-shot setting considered in this paper.
